availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Meade County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Evalinah Smith Hardaway in Meade County, Kentucky, on February 15, 1842. Father of Elizabeth Hardaway, Mary Hardaway, James Hardaway, Edward Hardaway, Richard Hardaway, and Walter Hardaway. Farmer in Meade County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Meade County in 1850. Farmer in Meade County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Meade County in 1860.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Meade County Marriages, Film 000390314.
